article.title: Measurement of the tZq cross section at 13 TeV with the CMS detector

multiple_choice_question.text: What information does the x-axis of the leftmost plot in Figure 1 represent?
choices: The transverse momentum of the Z boson.
The invariant mass of the two jets in the final state.
The combined secondary vertex tagger (CSVv2) discriminant.
The difference in azimuth between the lepton and the W boson decay direction.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the purpose of the hatched bands displayed in the histograms of Figure 1?
choices: To represent the statistical uncertainty associated with the data points.
To indicate the expected background contributions in each bin.
To highlight the signal region within the distribution.
To show the variation in the measurement across different data-taking periods.

multiple_choice_question.text: What can be concluded about the agreement between data and simulation based on the middle plot in the bottom row?
choices: The simulation perfectly describes the data across the entire range of the MEM discriminant.
There are significant discrepancies between data and simulation, particularly at low values of the MEM discriminant.
The simulation generally agrees well with the data, though minor discrepancies are observed.
The data is inconclusive and no firm conclusions can be drawn about the agreement with simulation.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the ΔR variable plotted on the rightmost plot represent?
choices: The difference in rapidity between the two b-tagged jets.
The angular separation between the most probable tZq decay products.
The difference in pseudorapidity between the lepton and the missing transverse energy.
The opening angle between the two leptons in the event.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the formula σ(pp → tZq →Wbl+l®q) = 123±39 fb represent?
choices: The predicted branching ratio of the tZq process.
The theoretical uncertainty on the tZq production cross section.
The measured cross section of the tZq process with its uncertainty.
The expected number of tZq events produced in the dataset.
